doc_title: 4. Yann LeCun on Open Source AI and AGI
claim: Concentration of power in a small number of proprietary AI systems (principally West Coast Big Tech) is a bigger danger than most other AI risks because it would let a few companies control the population's information diet and threaten democracy and cultural diversity; open-sourcing foundation models is the primary practical remedy because it enables governments, NGOs, local communities and startups to fine-tune models for local languages, values and needs.
explanation: There is strong evidence that foundation-model power is concentrated among a handful of large tech firms and that UK regulators (CMA) and major outlets regard this as a real competition risk. ([gov.uk](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/cma-ai-strategic-update/cma-ai-strategic-update?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [bbc.com](https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-68789880?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) Concentration plausibly amplifies threats to democracy and to cultural diversity by shaping what people see and by enabling large‑scale disinformation/targeting via platform algorithms. ([journalofdemocracy.org](https://www.journalofdemocracy.org/articles/how-ai-threatens-democracy/?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [carnegieendowment.org](https://carnegieendowment.org/research/2024/12/can-democracy-survive-the-disruptive-power-of-ai?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [unesco.org](https://www.unesco.org/creativity/en/articles/unesco-unites-diverse-perspectives-inform-policies-ai-creative-sectors?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) Open‑sourcing models has demonstrable benefits for localization and community-driven work (community MT projects, corporate/local fine‑tuning efforts and some open model releases), so it can help governments, NGOs and startups adapt models to local languages/values. ([arxiv.org](https://arxiv.org/abs/2003.11529?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [newsroom.orange.com](https://newsroom.orange.com/orange-to-expand-open-source-ai-models-to-african-regional-languages-for-digital-inclusion/?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Llama_%28language_model%29?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) However, calling consolidation the single "bigger" danger than most other AI risks and naming open‑sourcing the primary practical remedy overstates the case: open weights do not remove barriers from compute, proprietary data, platform distribution, or safety/misuse concerns, and experts urge a mix of policy tools (competition, governance, standards, transparency) alongside selective openness. ([brookings.edu](https://www.brookings.edu/articles/how-open-source-software-shapes-ai-policy/?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [cset.georgetown.edu](https://cset.georgetown.edu/article/open-foundation-models-implications-of-contemporary-artificial-intelligence/?utm_source=chatgpt.com))
